channel.title: tir
channel.description: "Today I Read:" a collection of the little things you read each day. Cherish them!

item.title: Landmark: Tarkovsky's Stalker
item.description: BBC radio interview about Stalker and its unplanned relationship with Chernobyl.

item.title: Privilege Escalation in Google Cloud Platform
item.description: What it says on the tin; part 1 specifically discusses IAM roles.

item.title: Second-Guessing the Modern Web
item.description: Discusses downsides to the high abstraction React offers.

item.title: What Journalists Should Know About the Atomic Bombings
item.description: The utilitarian justification (that it avoids a land invasion) is an ahistorical false dichotomy.

item.title: Oppenheimer and the Gita
item.description: Summarizes J. Hijiya's analysis: don't misunderstand 'I' to mean Oppenheimer.

item.title: DHS Authorizes Domestic Surveillance to Protect Statues and Monuments
item.description: Lawfare's analysis of this surveillance authorization, tied to the events in Portland

item.title: India, Jio, and the Four Internets
item.description: There are upsides to accepting the inefficiencies of a domestic telecom monopoly: it's a way for India to compete with the US

item.title: Capitalist Realism, Chapter 2
item.description: "There is a sense in which it simply is the case that the political elite are our servants; the miserable service they provide from us is to launder our libidos, to obligingly re-present for us our disavowed desires as if they had nothing to do with us."

item.title: How Wagner Shaped Hollywood
item.description: Wagner in both hegemonic and critical guises.
